Welcome to QL Workbench’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index
  • Module Index
  • Search Page
Usage: main.py [OPTIONS] <file>

This program generates a formulary based on QL files. It parses the
given <file> and generates a graphical interface based on the content.
In case it contains errors, they will be displayed in the screen.

Options:
    --help  Show this message and exit.

QL¶

QL Lexer¶

This module defines the parser of the QL language. It uses the PLY library to take a string and return instead a stream of tokens. PLY is often used as a single script but in this case we use a class for better encapsulation and code organisation.

class qlworkbench.ql.lexer.QLLexer(checker)¶

The QLLexer parser shaped as a class

t_COMMENT(t)¶

Comments are ignored

t_DECIMAL(t)¶

We make sure the value returned is an float

t_ID(t)¶

Identifies the ID tokens. It also identifies all the reserved words by looking them up in a dictionary and substituting the ID type for the reserved word.

t_WHITESPACE(t)¶

White spaces are ignored

t_error(t)¶

Error handler. It logs when a character is not recognised by any token of the lexer.

t_newline(t)¶

Tracks the line number for error reporting purposes.

QL Parser¶

This module defines the grammar of the QL language. Given the tokens described in qlworkbench.ql.parser.

The output of the parser is an AST tree. The AST tree has been processed to simplify the raw output of the grammar and some reduntant or innecesary nodes and tokens haven been merged. The resultant AST tree is sucession of nodes which each one represents one statement of the file and one field of the form.

The statement can be declarations of questions or assginations of values. They have three possible types: boolean, string and decimal. These statement can be conditional.

class qlworkbench.ql.parser.QLParser(tokens, checker)¶

Encapsulates the logic of the PLY parser.

p_assignation(p)¶

assignation : STR ID COLON type ASSIGN expression

p_comparison(p)¶
comparison : comparison LT expression
comparison LET expression
comparison GT expression
comparison GET expression
comparison NEQ expression
comparison EQ expression
expression
p_cond(p)¶
cond : cond AND comparison
cond OR comparison
comparison
p_condition(p)¶
condition : IF LPAREN cond RPAREN LBRACK statements RBRACK
IF LPAREN cond RPAREN LBRACK statements RBRACK ELSE LBRACK statements RBRACK
p_declaration(p)¶

declaration : STR ID COLON type

p_empty(p)¶

empty :

p_expression(p)¶
expression : expression PLUS term
expression MINUS term
term
p_factor(p)¶
factor : LPAREN cond RPAREN
NOT factor
TRUE
FALSE
DECIMAL
STR
ID
p_start(p)¶

start : FORM ID LBRACK statements RBRACK

p_statements(p)¶
statements : assignation statements
declaration statements
condition statements
empty statements
assignation
declaration
condition
empty
p_term(p)¶
term : term MULT factor
term DIV factor
factor
p_type(p)¶
type : BOOLEAN
DECIMAL
STRING

AST¶

The type module contains the information about the different types supported by the AST. Classes were not strictly necessary (a bunch of functions in the module could have make it too) but being able to pass a class made the whole process much easier.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.type.Boolean¶

Boolean (true/false) type

static allowed_operations()¶

List of allowed operations for the nodes of this type

static create_variable()¶

Initialises a UI variable of this type

static default_value()¶

Default value to use by the variables of this type in case they do not have any value.

static init_field(ui, variable, assignation=False)¶

Returns an input field of the type for declarations and assignations.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.type.Decimal¶

Decimal (numeric) type

static allowed_operations()¶

List of allowed operations for the nodes of this type

static create_variable()¶

Initialises a UI variable of this type

static default_value()¶

Default value to use by the variables of this type in case they do not have any value.

static init_field(ui, variable, assignation=False)¶

Returns an input field of the type for declarations and assignations.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.type.String¶

String (characters) type

static allowed_operations()¶

List of allowed operations for the nodes of this type

static create_variable()¶

Initialises a UI variable of this type

static default_value()¶

Default value to use by the variables of this type in case they do not have any value.

static init_field(ui, variable, assignation=False)¶

Returns an input field of the type for declarations and assignations.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.type.Type¶

Abstract parent class. Not supposed to be instantiated

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.type.Undefined¶

The Undefined type is used by the typechecker to refer to the type of an undefined unknown variable. This type should never pass the typechecker and reach the UI building as the pressence of this type is detected as a blocking grammar error.

static allowed_operations()¶

List of allowed operations for the nodes of this type

static create_variable()¶

Initialises a UI variable of this type

static default_value()¶

Default value to use by the variables of this type in case they do not have any value.

static init_field(ui, variable, assignation=False)¶

Returns an input field of the type for declarations and assignations.

This module holds the definition of the different nodes of the AST. The nodes can be the Declaration of new questions or the Assgination of values.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.node.Assignation(text, variable, type, expression)¶

Node which defines the assgination of values.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.node.Declaration(text, variable, type)¶

Node which defines a new question.

build_ui(ui)¶

Displays the declaration in the given UI.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.node.Node(variable, type)¶

Abstract parent class for Declaration and Assignation. It holds the shared logic between them. It is not supposed to be instantiated.

add_condition(expression)¶

Adds a new condition to the display of the node

get_value(context)¶

Returns the value of the node in a given context, usually the UI.

register(ql)¶

Adds the node the given AST.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.node.Root¶

Initialises a root node. The root node holds every other node existing in the tree. The result is a flatten tree in which the root has a list with every descendant declaration or assignation, which hold their own conditions.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.node.Variable(variable, type)¶

The variable class stores the name of a variable and its type. Every variable declared or assigned is stored as an instance of this class.

get_value(context)¶

Returns the value of the variable in a given context, usually the UI.

This module holds the definition of the expressions that can be found in the AST tree. The expressions are not nodes by themselves but they are part of the nodes. The express the conditions of the conditionals or the evaluation of the values in the assignation nodes. They are not visually represented in the UI but hold most of the logic behind it.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.AndExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Logic AND expression. It takes two Boolean and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.BinaryExpression(type, operation, lnode, rnode)¶

Parent abstract class for binary expressions.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.DecimalExpression(decimal)¶

Leaf expression which holds a Decimal value.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.DivExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical DIVIDE BY expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Decimal.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.EQExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Logic EQUAL expression. It takes two variables of the same any type and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.Expression(type)¶

Abstract parent class. It defines the shared fields and functions that all the nodes have. This is very important as during the recurision, the visitor will rely on them.

depends_on()¶

Gets the list of the variables that the expression depends on. This means that if any children or children of them of the expression contains the identifier of a variable, this one will be returned by this function as a list. In case it does not has any dependency, this list will be empty.

get_children()¶

Returns a list of the children of the node. In case it is a LeafNode, the list will be empty.

get_type(context)¶

Returns the type of the expression. In most of the cases it depends on the operation but in case it is an identifier it depends on the context it is analysed as we do not have the declaration of the identifier in the expression.

get_value(context)¶

Retrieves the value of the expression node depending on the context. Usually this value is recursive and depends on the value of the children of the expression node.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.FalseExpression¶

Leaf expression which holds the Boolean value False.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.GETExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical GREATER OR EQUAL THAN expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.GTExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical GREATER THAN expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.IdExpression(id)¶

ID expressions are a leaf expression which are quite different from the others, although it holds many of the same properties and principles. The most important one is that its type and value depends strictly on the context given. Without a valid context, the IdExpressions will fail.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.LETExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical LESS OR EQUAL THAN expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.LTExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical LESS THAN expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.LeafExpression(type)¶

Abstract parent class for leaf expressions.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.MinusExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical MINUS expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Decimal.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.MultExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical MULTIPLY BY expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Decimal.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.NEQExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Logic NOT EQUAL expression. It takes two variables of the same any type and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.NotExpression(node)¶

Logical NOT operation. It takes a Boolean and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.OrExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Logic OR expression. It takes two Boolean and returns a Boolean.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.PlusExpression(lnode, rnode)¶

Mathematical PLUS expression. It takes two Decimal and returns a Decimal.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.StringExpression(string)¶

Leaf expression which holds a String value.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.TrueExpression¶

Leaf expression which holds the Boolean value True.

class qlworkbench.ql.ast.expression.UnaryExpression(type, operation, node)¶

Abstract parent class for unary expressions.

Checkers¶

This module contains the error checker. The error checker is in charge of making sure that there are no errors in the QL program that would make the program to crash. The error checker accepts different types of checker engines at the same time to catch all the different types of errors.

class qlworkbench.typechecker.checker.Checker¶

This class contains the list of errors and warnings of the checkers. It is used by the different checkers to register their errors.

add_error(node, message)¶

Adds a new error to the error list.

add_warning(node, message)¶

Adds a new warning to the warning list.

get_errors()¶

Retrieves a list of reported errors.

get_warnings()¶

Retrieves a list of reported warning.

class qlworkbench.typechecker.checker.CheckerMessage(node, message)¶

Parent abstract class which holds the information necessary by the checker to display a message.

class qlworkbench.typechecker.checker.Error(node, message)¶

Class which holds a checker error.

class qlworkbench.typechecker.checker.Warning(node, message)¶

Class which holds a checker warning.

This module contains the definition of a Lexer checker. This module is passed to the lexer which will report the errors to it when they are detected.

This module contains the definition of a Parser checker. This module is passed to the parser which will report the errors to it when they are detected.

This module contains the logic of the QL checker. The QL checker looks for and reports errors in the AST tree. This module concreteley detects:

  • Duplicated declarations.
  • Duplicated labels.
  • Invalid assignations.
  • Invalid conditions.
  • Invalid operands.
  • Cyclic dependencies.
  • Undefined dependencies.

GUI¶

Builder¶

This module takes care of the construction of the UI that the user will interact with. This only contains the TK related logic, the application logic, result of the parsing, is located in a context class so it can be easily modified or substituted.

class qlworkbench.ui.builder.Builder¶

This class represents a UI object. It initalises the environment and allows to place different types of widgets. The available widgets depends on the variable type (boolean, decimal or string) and they can be set as writing widgets which allow the users to change their values, or to as reading widgets which will be used to display the information of calcualted variables.

add_assignation(text, variable, expr, conditions)¶

Adds an assignation to the form using the given text, variable, expression and conditions. The type and format of the questions will depend on the type of the variable given.

add_question(text, variable, conditions)¶

Adds a question to the form using the given text, variable and conditions. The type and format of the questions will depend on the type of the variable given.

run()¶

Loads the elements in the GUI. Every element is a set of label + field which are placed in different rows. They are placed in the same order as they were defined. After that, it grabs the window’s focus and leaves the application in a running state.

set_title(text='QL Workbench')¶

Assigns the given title to the UI. In case no parameter is passed, it uses ‘QL Workbench’

class qlworkbench.ui.builder.Visitor(root)¶

Implements the visitor pattern. Given an AST and a GUI builder, it will go trough the AST to retrieve all the nodes and use them to build the user interface.

Context¶

The ui.context module defines all the classes necessary to describe the context of an user interface. Although it has been designed with the module ui.builder in mind, it should be easily substituted.

class qlworkbench.ui.context.UIContext¶

The UIContext class is esentially a wrapper of a native dictionary which stores in every entry a pair of variable name (key) and register (value). The functions defined add extra features and checks to the original dictionary. Every register is an instance of the UIRegister class.

It also holds an event manager to deal with the updates of the variables of the registers.

add(variable, value, ui, conditions=[], expression=None)¶

This function will add a new entry to the register. The optional paramenters allow adding both declaration and assignation nodes to the register. Conditions are optional, depending on the node.

get_value(id)¶

Retrieves the value of the variable with name id

set_value(id, new_value)¶

Sets the value of the register with variable name id

update(variable_name)¶

Given the name of a variable, it updates its status and the status of all the other variables that depend on it.

update_all()¶

Updates the status of all the registers. Some of the values of the register have an uncertain status as they depend on runtime values. This function makes sure that all of them have the right values with the default runtime values.

Event manager¶

This module defines a simple event manager that works on a basis of publishers and subscribers. This is used in combination with the class ui.context to update the values of the variables when they change.

class qlworkbench.ui.event_manager.EventManager(updater)¶

Simple event manager based on the bulletin board pattern. It defines a unique handler and a unique event for simplicity.

get_publishers()¶

Retrieves all the declared publishers.

publish(publisher)¶

Updates all the subscribers of the publisher

subscribe(subscriber, publisher)¶

Subscribers the subscriber to the publisher events
